trans-unit.source: Writes data to the STDOUT stream. Some text editors can read this stream as can other programs which may be expecting data on this stream.

seg-source.mrk: Writes data to the STDOUT stream.
Some text editors can read this stream as can other programs which may be expecting data on this stream.

target.mrk: Writes data to the STDOUT stream.
Some text editors can read this stream as can other programs which may be expecting data on this stream.

trans-unit.source: The data you wish to output. This may either be text or binary.

seg-source.mrk: The data you wish to output.
This may either be text or binary.

target.mrk: The data you wish to output.
This may either be text or binary.

trans-unit.source: The amount of data written. If writing binary, the number of bytes written, if writing text, the number of characters written.

seg-source.mrk: If writing binary, the number of bytes written, if writing text, the number of characters written.

target.mrk: If writing binary, the number of bytes written, if writing text, the number of characters written.

trans-unit.source: The purpose for this function is to write to the STDOUT stream. Many popular text editors can read this stream. Scripts compiled as Console applications also have a STDOUT stream.

seg-source.mrk: The purpose for this function is to write to the STDOUT stream.
Many popular text editors can read this stream.
Scripts compiled as Console applications also have a STDOUT stream.

target.mrk: The purpose for this function is to write to the STDOUT stream.
Many popular text editors can read this stream.
Scripts compiled as Console applications also have a STDOUT stream.

trans-unit.source: This does not write to a DOS console unless the script is compiled as a console application.

seg-source.mrk: This does not write to a DOS console unless the script is compiled as a console application.

target.mrk: This does not write to a DOS console unless the script is compiled as a console application.

trans-unit.source: Characters are converted to ANSI before being written.

seg-source.mrk: Characters are converted to ANSI before being written.

target.mrk: Characters are converted to ANSI before being written.

trans-unit.source: Binary data is written as-is. It will not be converted to a string. To print the hex representation of binary data, use the String() function to explicitly cast the data to a string.

seg-source.mrk: It will not be converted to a string.
To print the hex representation of binary data, use the String() function to explicitly cast the data to a string.

target.mrk: It will not be converted to a string.
To print the hex representation of binary data, use the String() function to explicitly cast the data to a string.
